episodeTitle: Broggy's Bitter Tears of Victory! The Conclusion of Elbaf!
episodeTitleJapanese: ブロギー勝利の号泣！エルバフの決着
episodeTitleRomanized: Burogī Shōri no Gōkyū! Erubafu no Ketchaku!
description: Dorry refuses Luffy's pleas to avoid combat despite his injuries and pins him under a boulder. The giants' duel resumes, but Mr. 3 sabotages the fight, causing Brogy to defeat Dorry. Mr. 3 then traps Brogy in wax while Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine attack the Straw Hats.

events.title: Dorry Refuses to Back Down
events.description: Despite suffering severe internal injuries from the exploding rum, Dorry insists on fighting Brogy to honor their century-long duel. He recognizes Luffy and the Straw Hats are innocent and reconciles with them, but refuses to avoid the fight as his warrior god wills it.
events.significance: Demonstrates the unwavering honor and warrior code of the Elbaf giants, establishing the importance of their duel and foreshadowing the consequences of Mr. 3's interference.

quotes.text: I cannot avoid this fight no matter how injured I am, as my god wills it.
quotes.speaker: Dorry
quotes.context: Dorry explaining to Luffy why he must fight despite his injuries

events.title: Dorry Pins Luffy Under a Boulder
events.description: To prevent Luffy from interfering in the sacred duel, Dorry places a massive boulder on top of the young pirate captain. This shows the giant's determination to fight Brogy on his own terms, even if it means victory through his injuries.
events.significance: Shows Dorry's respect for the sanctity of their duel and his warrior pride. It also demonstrates Luffy's growing respect for others' convictions, even when he disagrees.

events.title: 73,466th Duel Between Dorry and Brogy Begins
events.description: The two giants meet in the center of the island for their 73,466th battle, continuing their century-long tradition. Brogy is unaware of Dorry's severe internal injuries from the sabotaged rum.
events.significance: This duel becomes pivotal as it marks the first time their sacred combat is corrupted by outside interference, setting up the conflict with Baroque Works.

events.title: Nami and Zoro Captured by Wax Duplicates
events.description: While attempting to cross the jungle, Nami is distracted by a life-sized wax duplicate of Luffy created by Mr. 3's Doru Doru no Mi powers. Zoro is similarly captured by wax traps.
events.significance: First demonstration of Mr. 3's tactical use of his wax powers to create elaborate traps, showcasing his methodical and artistic approach to assassination.

events.title: Mr. 3 Sabotages the Duel with Wax
events.description: As Dorry struggles against Brogy while hiding his injuries, Mr. 3 interferes by creating a slippery wax substance under Dorry's foot, causing him to slip and leave himself open to Brogy's attack.
events.significance: This is the crucial moment where the sacred duel is corrupted. It demonstrates Mr. 3's cunning strategy and willingness to dishonor the giants' tradition to complete his mission.

events.title: Brogy Defeats Dorry
events.description: Thanks to Mr. 3's interference combined with Dorry's severe internal injuries, Brogy lands a decisive blow that defeats Dorry. Brogy believes he has won fairly and is initially triumphant, not knowing about the sabotage.
events.significance: This marks the first time in their century-long duel that one giant has truly defeated the other, but the victory is tainted by deception. This moment is crucial to understanding the giants' honor code.

events.title: Brogy's Tears of Victory
events.description: Brogy stands over Dorry's defeated body in tears, mourning the apparent death of his friend and rival of 100 years. Despite their endless duel, the deep bond between the two warriors is evident.
events.significance: This emotional moment reveals that despite fighting for a century, the two giants remain close friends. It emphasizes the complexity of their relationship and the honor in their combat.

events.title: Mr. 3 Traps Brogy in Wax
events.description: As Brogy grieves over Dorry, Mr. 3 reveals himself and uses his Doru Doru no Mi powers to encase Brogy's feet in iron-hard wax, immobilizing the giant. Mr. 3 then begins covering more of Brogy's body in wax.
events.significance: Demonstrates the formidable restraining power of the Doru Doru no Mi against even giant-sized opponents. This sets up Mr. 3's plan to create wax statues of his victims.

events.title: Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine Attack at Dorry's Camp
events.description: At Dorry's camp, Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine confront Luffy, Usopp, and Vivi after defeating Karoo. They use their Devil Fruit powers to attack the Straw Hats.
events.significance: This splits the conflict into multiple fronts, forcing the Straw Hats to deal with threats on different parts of the island simultaneously.

events.title: Mr. 5's Kick Bomb Debut
events.description: Mr. 5 demonstrates his Kick Bomb technique, using his Bomu Bomu no Mi ability to create explosive attacks with his kicks.
events.significance: Expands the known abilities of the Bomu Bomu no Mi, showing Mr. 5 can make any part of his body explosive, not just his breath or boogers.

events.title: Mr. 5 Captures Vivi
events.description: Mr. 5 successfully captures Princess Vivi, intending to bring her to Mr. 3. Meanwhile, Miss Valentine uses her Kilo Kilo no Mi powers to stomp Usopp chest-deep into the ground.
events.significance: Raises the stakes for the Straw Hats as their companion and the person they're trying to protect is captured by Baroque Works agents.

events.title: Vivi Reveals the Sabotage to Brogy
events.description: Vivi explains to the trapped Brogy that his victory over Dorry was achieved through sabotage - a bomb was planted in the rum that injured Dorry before the fight. Brogy becomes enraged upon learning his victory was not earned fairly.
events.significance: This revelation devastates Brogy's warrior pride and honor, showing how much the fair fight meant to him. It also exposes Mr. 3's complete disregard for the giants' sacred traditions.

events.title: Mr. 3 Reveals His Wax Statue Plan
events.description: Mr. 3 announces his intention to turn Brogy, along with the captured Straw Hats (Zoro, Nami, and Vivi), into wax statues as part of his twisted artistic vision. He places them on a giant candelabra.
events.significance: Reveals Mr. 3's sadistic artistic nature and sets up the dire situation for the next episode. The wax statues represent both a death sentence and a mockery of his victims.

events.title: Doru Doru no Mi Name Revealed
events.description: Vivi identifies Mr. 3's Devil Fruit as the Doru Doru no Mi (Wax-Wax Fruit), and Mr. 5 provides additional explanation of its abilities, noting that the hardened wax is as strong as steel.
events.significance: Provides crucial information about Mr. 3's Devil Fruit powers and establishes the properties of wax in the One Piece world, including its remarkable strength when hardened.

quotes.text: I cannot avoid this fight no matter how injured I am, as my god wills it.
quotes.speaker: Dorry
quotes.context: Explaining to Luffy why he must fight Brogy despite his injuries

quotes.text: The wax is as strong as steel when hardened.
quotes.speaker: Mr. 5
quotes.context: Explaining the properties of Mr. 3's Doru Doru no Mi powers

themes.description: The episode explores the concept of warrior honor through Dorry and Brogy's sacred duel, which is corrupted by Mr. 3's interference. Brogy's devastation upon learning his victory was tainted demonstrates how important fair combat is to the Elbaf giants.
themes.symbolism: The century-long duel represents unwavering commitment to one's principles and the sanctity of honorable combat.

themes.description: Despite being locked in mortal combat for 100 years, Dorry and Brogy's deep friendship remains intact. Brogy's tears over Dorry's defeat show that their bond transcends their endless battle.
themes.symbolism: The giants crying over each other's apparent death symbolizes how true friendship can exist even in the context of conflict.

themes.description: Mr. 3's sabotage of the duel represents the corruption of sacred traditions by those who don't understand or respect them. His artistic pretensions mask his dishonorable tactics.
themes.symbolism: The wax that traps the giants symbolizes how deception can bind even the mightiest warriors.

characterSpotlights.development: Dorry's unwavering commitment to the duel despite severe injuries showcases the depth of Elbaf warrior culture and sets up the tragedy of his defeat.
keyActions: Reconciles with Luffy and the Straw Hats
Pins Luffy under a boulder to prevent interference
Fights Brogy while hiding his injuries
Is defeated due to combined injuries and sabotage
quotes: I cannot avoid this fight no matter how injured I am, as my god wills it.

characterSpotlights.role: Unwitting victor in a corrupted duel
characterSpotlights.development: Brogy's emotional journey from triumph to devastation upon learning about the sabotage reveals the importance of honor to the giants and makes him sympathetic.
keyActions: Defeats Dorry and weeps over his body
Is trapped by Mr. 3's wax powers
Learns about the sabotage from Vivi and becomes enraged

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 3 is established as a methodical and artistic villain who uses elaborate schemes rather than direct confrontation. His disregard for the giants' honor makes him particularly villainous.
keyActions: Captures Nami and Zoro with wax duplicates
Sabotages Dorry and Brogy's duel with slippery wax
Reveals his plan to create wax statues of his victims

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi demonstrates her knowledge and analytical skills by identifying the Doru Doru no Mi and explaining the sabotage to Brogy, though she ends up captured.
keyActions: Identifies Mr. 3's Devil Fruit as the Doru Doru no Mi

characterSpotlights.role: Concerned friend trying to prevent tragedy
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows growth by respecting Dorry's decision to fight even though he disagrees with it, demonstrating his developing understanding of others' convictions.
keyActions: Tries to convince Dorry not to fight
Is pinned under a boulder by Dorry
Confronts Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine at Dorry's camp

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the action sequences during the giants' duel compared to the manga's more condensed version.
Some dialogue and emotional reactions were expanded in the anime, particularly Brogy's tears over Dorry's defeat.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the final appearance of 'Watashi ga Iru Yo' by Tomato Cube as the ending theme, which had been used since episode 64.
This is the 73,466th duel between Dorry and Brogy, meaning they've been fighting approximately once every 12 hours for 100 years.

sources.title: Little Garden Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 73 covers manga chapters 119 and 120, maintaining a relatively close adaptation of about 2 chapters per episode during this arc.
Mr. 5's Kick Bomb technique debuts in this episode, expanding the known applications of the Bomu Bomu no Mi.
